alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of the central City of Virginia Beach through 415 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Princess Anne, or over Virginia Beach, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of the central City of Virginia Beach, including the following locations... Oceana, Rudee Heights, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Dam Neck, Oceana NAS, Macons Corner, Pungo and London Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
